channel.title: Mudclient 204
channel.description:
Does anyone know of any compatable servers with mudclient 204, unedited. And is there any bugs in the actual client? afaik it's come straight from runescape.com and it's been untouched, also, how do you get into the .jag / .mem files ? were the .rscd files re-written in their own format?
ty.

item.title: Mudclient 204
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

dimebagx:

It’s jagex’s own format isn’t it ? Jagbytes or somthing I read?

the format is called jag (i don’t know where you pulled bytes from)

Read full topic

item.title: Mudclient 204
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:18, topic:354148”][quote author=super_ link=topic=450438.msg3305806#msg3305806 date=1281657026]

definitely was not bzip1. stop bullshitting.
[/quote]Rsc did use a bzip compression and seeming as it was not bzip2 I said its bzip1, Gosh super_ you come here troll everywhere how about get your dick out of your own ass and stop being a stuck up prick? seriously not cool

the code is most definitely bzip2.

I want to take Rawr’s side on this, because all you do is troll…[/quote]

you are such a fucking retard.
it is most definitely bzip2; if you refactor the code you can clearly see that. bzip1 isn’t even legally allowed to be used without permission because it uses a proprietary arithmetic coding as opposed to Huffman and the ‘selector’ decoding table lists in bzip2.
dimebagx, no need to google considering i would think the person who fucking figured out what the class even did in the first place was me. regardless that last thread is certainly not ‘rawr monster cookies’.

Read full topic

lol. you noob. why can’t you help me then

you have no idea how much searching and trial and error me and a mate have done to try get this going.

item.description:

[quote=“dimebagx, post:19, topic:354148”]im pretty sure 99% of this forum do.

may aswell make a seperate page for fucking dramas

Research:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,420667.msg3089923.html#msg3089923

“this is the clients BZIP2 headerless compression in 317 its used for the NamedArchives(What you call streamloaders) , in 508 its one of the 2 compressions supported by the JaGeX cache container format (JAG FORMAT) the other format is GZIP with headers”
it’s rs2 but it might be relevant[/quote]Hehe, all them threads you have just linked is me ROFL

item.title: Mudclient 204
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

[quote=“object, post:4, topic:354148”]FreeScape uses version 201 and MoonScape does not exist. However, MoonSpell does, and uses version 202.

As far as I can tell, the file formats used for RSCD v. 25 must have been re-written. I never really looked into it myself, but that’s what I have heard.[/quote]
My bad I was sure it was something starting with ‘moon’, I really don’t see the difference between 202 and 204.

Read full topic

item.title: Mudclient 204
item.dc:creator: @Rawr_monster_cookies Rawr monster cookies
item.description:
@Rawr_monster_cookies wrote:

[quote=“dimebagx, post:1, topic:354148”]Does anyone know of any compatable servers with mudclient 204, unedited.
And is there any bugs in the actual client? afaik it’s come straight from runescape.com
and it’s been untouched, also, how do you get into the .jag / .mem files ?
were the .rscd files re-written in their own format?

ty.[/quote]Runescape Classic uses bzip1, but rscd has dumped the data and compressed them into a zip the only format what was changed was the landscape format. But the Cache Files are just compressed zip files instread of compressed bzip

Read full topic

item.title: Mudclient 204
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

FreeScape uses version 201 and MoonScape does not exist. However, MoonSpell does, and uses version 202.

As far as I can tell, the file formats used for RSCD v. 25 must have been re-written. I never really looked into it myself, but that’s what I have heard.

Read full topic
